result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jeffrey Howard Buchert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant may not possess any firearms or ammunition. 9:59 am - Defendant Jeffrey Howard Buchert appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire and waive of rights provided to Court. DA states agreement and moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. A - receiving stolen property. Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court orders Ct. 1 amended to Misd. A - Receiving stolen property.  DE pleads GUILTY to charges.   Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Victim R. Thompson speaks. Victim M. Kronberger speaks. Comments by DA. Comments and ruling by Court. Court orders modification of bond. Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on amended Ct. 1 and defers entry of JOC on Ct. 2 for a period of 2 years. 
Court imposes:
Ct. 1 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS
30 day jail term, with huber privileges, to commence within 30 days from 06-10-15.
$5419 Rest + 10% of $541.90 = $5960.90 Restitution, Joint & Several with Theresa Buchert
Apology to victims in way and manner to be determined by agent
Psychological assessment and follow through

Ct. 2 - Deferred for a period of 2 years or the length of probation, whichever is longer.  See written order
Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:35 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-10-2015 10:00 am
Wisconsin SPD Eligibility Evaluation Form
Request for court appointed attorney - denied

2:46 pm - Defendant Jeffrey Howard Buchert appeared with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by Atty. Drewa regarding motion.  Response by Court.  Gregory Wirsing called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty. Drewa.  Redirect.  Recross.  Exhibit 1 marked, identified, offered and received.  Redirect.  Christopher Jarosinski called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty. Drewa.  Argument by parties.  Court comments and finds probable cause that felony has been committed and binds defendant over for trial.  DA files information.  Parties receive and review and waive reading.  DE pleads NOT GUILTY to charges.  Motion to be held for later date.  Adj.  3:37 pm.
